text: come on this is CJ Cheevers of the New

3rd battalion six Marines had been
pushing through Marja a Taliban held
area in southern Afghanistan the Taliban
were resisting often their tactic is to
hit and run and they aren't known as
accomplished shots but on this day they
massed and attack two marine platoons
they also had at least one man with them
the Marines considered to be a sniper
which was unusual deep were those
impacts use for this court in both ways
the squirters as sergeant Brian Rogers a

to escape across the open steppe the
sergeant ordered several Marines
including Lance Corporal Travis piccola
who is 20 to suppress the Taliban
positions with gunfire at least one
sniper maybe more was adjusting his
shots he'd almost determined the range
and was overcoming the stiff crosswind
listen closely as bullets pass overhead
from a rifle heavier than a Kalashnikov
the Taliban usually shoot poorly not
today sometimes in a firefight inches
matter a dirt wall in the right place
like this one can mean the difference
between living and dying especially at
times like now when a gunman in hiding
has found the range
the sniper is likely using a rifle like
these which were found hidden in an
Afghan home several hundred yards away
there Lian fields one was made in 1942
in the right hand it's still deadly the
Marines here were working on a clear and
early step in the phases that now define

goal was to push the Taliban out of the
area so that government might be
established and security transferred
from American to Afghan hands they
expected this fight they expect more in
a lull sergeant Rogers wooden rain to

out again
the rounds passed by helmets then the

Lance Corporal vu Colo though he had

had been shot through the shoulder his
bad luck was mixed with good the round
missed the bone this was his second

Oh pods what is it kV four six four

his life 7 applause 8 inches to the

instant of good fortune means little the
next after the Cola was shot
Marines working at a distant camp fired
at least one guided ground-to-ground
missile to help kilo companies fight the
ordinance did not hit the compound from
which these Marines were taking fire it
hit another nearby several hundred yards
to the left at least 12 Afghan civilians
were killed including 5 children an ugly
day turned uglier for everyone involved
and presented the Marines in Marja with
a fresh challenge when the fighting
would finally let up then they would be
seeking civilian support
